title: When towers die they should explode, killing all of the minions who are in it's range
body:
This way the enemy split pusher can't just take out 3 towers in a row with one-two waves of minions
This will reset the wave making it so taking towers closer to the enemy base are a little more difficult
Tell me what you think
C:

sounds like a bad idea to me, that kinda destroys the main idea behind splitting in the first place. itwould create a situation where the team losing would have much more of a harder time coming back. taking objectives on general (Lets say yuo won a fight and u take 1 tower but then u dont have minions anymore.) would be more difficult too. either u have a tank to tank it or the other team just doesnt lose much.

As someone who played a bit of vainglory (admittedly pretty different in a lot of ways) the turrets exploding wasn't a huge deal.  Instead of killing the minions they would roughly half health them, which meant that the next turret burned through the wave much faster.  So instead of resetting the wave it just weakens it.
Vainglory has only one lane though, so it's not really about splitpushing as much as group pushing after killing the enemy team.
That is true.
You still give global gold and apply pressure, but now you don't lose your nexus if you want to win the fight, rather than sending 1-2 people top

That would also make comebacks more difficult and could prolong the length of matches in general.

EDIT: Might be a nice option for ARAM though. Maybe...

While I don't agree with you, I'm going to give you an upvote for offering an idea I haven't thought of before.  

IMO, the best way to make it so that enemies can't push so hard is to reduce damage across the board. That way towers don't disappear in 5 seconds, ADCs don't get killed in 0.08 seconds, one hit doesn't chunk for half or more HP (eg. Gangplank) and people actually feel like they had a chance to play a strategical game, all at the cost of a somewhat longer game.

I like the idea. Another similar idea would be to give a temporary buff, maybe 2 or 3 min, to the leftover tower in the lane (think of it as an emergency mode). The buff would either fortify its defenses or increase its AD and AS.

Its a good idea in theory, but think about how long this would delay games.  You would probably only be able to get 1 tower max on every ace your team gets.  This means it could theoretically take 3 consecutive aces with minions pushed up to kill the nexus towers.

Not a fan. This fucks over split pushers for doing something that the enemy team deserves to be punished for if they don't respond in the time frames that you are talking about. It also makes it much harder to come back from losing if you are down in objectives, making snowballing much harder to stop than it already is.
